title: Knife River Indian Villages National Historic Site: Park Home
body: Explore the lives of the Northern Plains Indians on the Upper Missouri  Earthlodge people hunted bison and other game, but were in essence farmers living in villages along the Missouri and its tributaries. The site was a major Native American trade center for hundreds of years prior to becoming an important market place for fur traders after 1750.              History & Culture   Two children re enacting village life          Robinson Collection   Beaded Gloves in the Robinson Collection            Kid's Camp   Canoes during kids camp        Nature   Porcupine, linked to the parks nature informaiton        Education   Earthlodge school program
